comments:
In this course, disease is evaluated in its culture context, based on findings in skeletal and mummified paleopathologic specimens. There is also instruction in examination of specimens.

Overall, students loved this course, describing its material as “interesting” and “exactly what I've been hoping to find in a course at Penn.” It was also described as being an “absolute favorite.” One student, though, said that while the course was enjoyable, he wished it was “more challenging.” 

Students raved about the quality of Dr. Zimmerman’s teaching abilities. He was described as “funny,” “stimulating,” and “thorough.” Students praised the inclusion of his first-hand experience which “brought a sense of immediacy” and interest to the course. Many students were impressed with his intelligence and depth of knowledge, as well as his ability to make complex material seem easy. 

The course is recommended for senior anthropology majors, graduate students, and medical students. There are no prerequisites for this course.
